article_node.title: Noem defends deployment of the National Guard in U.S. cities.
article_node.summary: Kristi Noem defended President Trump’s deployment of the National Guard to quell protests in Los Angeles and is advocating similar moves in Chicago and other Democratic‑leaning cities. Trump has directed the Defense Department to take a larger role in domestic law enforcement, citing the LA deployment as a model. Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson has issued an executive order rejecting federal troop deployment and demanding local police not assist, citing constitutional rights. The debate highlights tensions between federal authority and local autonomy over civil unrest.
